intro: Elaphoglossum tolimense, commonly known as the Tolima holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a serrated margin and a distinctive, wiry rachis. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and rocky habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a subject of interest for both horticultural and taxonomic studies.
